issues.title: Links must be distinguishable without relying on color
issues.description: Ensure links are distinguished from surrounding text in a way that does not rely on color

relatedNodes.html: In the year 2022: Pricing changed by 11.58%, which is significantly above the average yearly change for citrus fruits during the 2022-2023 time period. Compared to inflation for all items in 2022 (8%), inflation for citrus fruits was much higher.

any.message: The link has insufficient color contrast of 2.62:1 with the surrounding text. (Minimum contrast is 3:1, link text: #7c4dff, surrounding text: #333333)

relatedNodes.html: In the year 2022: Pricing changed by 11.58%, which is significantly above the average yearly change for citrus fruits during the 2022-2023 time period. Compared to inflation for all items in 2022 (8%), inflation for citrus fruits was much higher.

any.message: The link has no styling (such as underline) to distinguish it from the surrounding text

relatedNodes.html:
* Not final. See inflation summary for latest details.
** Extended periods of 0% inflation usually indicate incomplete underlying data. This can manifest as a sharp increase in inflation later on.

issues.description: Ensure links are distinguished from surrounding text in a way that does not rely on color

relatedNodes.html: Source: U.S. Bureau of Labor Statistics began tracking the Consumer Price Index for Citrus fruits in 1997. In addition to citrus fruits, the index produces monthly data on changes in prices paid by urban consumers for a variety of goods and services.

issues.title: Links rely on color to be distinguishable.
issues.description: Low-contrast text is difficult or impossible for many users to read. Link text that is discernible improves the experience for users with low vision. [Learn how to make links distinguishable](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/4.10/link-in-text-block).
